content.description: Start matched on edge and work left before busting right and straight up. Lock off or slap through to a good but slightly hollow jug. A little spooky but good fun.
content.location: Start same as warm up problem. In between the anvil boulder and Donkey Kong country.

content.description: Fun easy little warm up for the area.
content.location: Start matched on decent edge. Work left and up to an easy top out.

content.description: Easy warm up and a bit silly. Start low near obvious crack and work up. One of the few problems where it feels more contrived not to brace against the tree behind you, aka phoning the friend. Do what you suites your fancy.
content.location: Large obvious crack in between anvil boulder and donkey Kong country, right of unknown 2.

content.description: Sit start in a rather tight dug out pit and climb out the arete on sharp crimps.
content.location: This problem is on the south side of the Anvil boulder, climbing out a short and steep arete.

content.description: Sit start on an overhanging crack feature, climb up and make a technical mantle on edges at the top. You can also link this problem left into Anvil arete, May bump it up a grade.
content.location: As you approach from the main trail, this problem is on the north side of the Anvil boulder.

content.description: Sit start on opposing underclings. Using all the tension, climb through a series of oddly angled positive holds to a distinguished crux throw to a positive sloping ball type hold. Finish up on easy terrain. This problem is an interesting mix of power and technique requiring a good amount of finger strength, although the holds are pretty friendly for the Peaks.
content.location: From the Weatherford Trail, take a right at the first major turn onto a distinguished trail. Continue on this trail for approximately five minutes and look out for this overhanging boulder on the right hand side. It is also just above and easily visible from the Anvil Arete

content.description: Sit start on opposing holds and climb through an undercling feature out to a positive arete and top out.
content.location: Off of the main trail this problem is approximately 100 feet downhill and is pretty obvious.

content.description: This is the first area as you approach top down from the Weatherford Trail. It offers some good variety of difficulties. The area is heavily sheltered in Timber and provides for good shade opportunities in the warmer summer months and is beautiful in the Fall. I have highlighted some of the classics, but don't list out some of the warm-ups but there are good quality problems in the VO-V2 range here also. Feel free to add any of these if you have info.
